intro: Diasperus gomphocarpus, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and milky sap, which is toxic to livestock. The plant belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with poisonous properties. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitat.
